name: Hotel Puerta del Mar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here from 29th September to the 1st October,what a gem. A tip for parking,go to the underground car park at the Balcon,unload the car it is only two minutes to the hotel. After checking in take your car to the large free car park on the edge of town.
reviews.title: Central Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean,the pool is a bonus ,staff helpful,breakfast fine.
reviews.title: Great little Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and I went out to Nerja for a wedding in September 2011 and booked this hotel after reading reviews on Tripadvisor. What a great find, can't recomend it enough. Great value, spotlessly clean, friendly and helpful staff, air conditioned bedrooms, good breakfast, centrally located (opposite the church for the wedding!) From reports from other wedding guests staying in more expensive hotels in he town, we got lucky. Thanks To Javier and the team. Well done. I have no hesitation whatsoever in reciomending this hotel - enjoy! Gerry
reviews.title: Charming small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel from 22nd to 26th September 2011. Only a two star hotel so expected everything to be basic. However it was a lovely hotel with air con. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean with fridge, hair dryer and TV. We had a double balcony and as the hotel is in a side street off the Balcon de Europa it is very quiet. The staff are very helpful and spoke good English and the breakfast was fine with plenty of meat, bread and cheese and cereal. The photos do not do the roof terrace justice as it is very spacious beyond the pool. Everywhere is clean and bright.
reviews.title: Well priced, friendly, thoughtfully decorated hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: There is no bar area but they will sell drinks on request and we drank on the internal terrace on the first floor for a quick pre meal drink. However it is so close to the restaurants and larger hotels on the Balcon de Europa the absence of a formal eating and drinking area did not matter. I would also refer readers to the Hostal Marissal across the square on the Balcon. Other family members stayed here. Whilst it did not have a 24 hour reception, the rooms were beautiful and overlooked the square on one side. There was a lovely cafe area where you could buy cooked breakfast. We had never been to Nerja before and were there for a wedding. Family were staying in all sorts of places including villas in the centre of the town and everyone was pleased with the accomodation and the town which is picturesque with its rocky coastline and beaches. Would stay at the Puerto del Mar again.
reviews.title: great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Puerta del mar was a recommendation from a colleague; I then looked at Trip advisor to find a number one rating. If you want a small hotel in a great location with polite and efficient staff that this is it.
reviews.title: Dubious about number 1 rated? Don’t be…………..this is well deserved!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First the downside……….it is difficult to find, you cannot drive to the hotel. Follow signs for the Balcon de Europa, and you will find a large underground car park. Park here and walk to hotel, it is right next to the church. Quickly check in, and the staff will give you a map to a FREE car park, just on the edge of town. It was a ten minute walk to back to the hotel.
reviews.title: Thoroughly deserves it's Trip Advisor rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is spotlessly clean. Our room was more than adequate, fridge, safe, TV (with good selection of UK and European channels), proper bath with powerful shower over it. Lovely terrace with small pool on roof……………lovely views over town, sea and mountains. Breakfast is basic (Spanish style) but more than adequate and it’s served until 1100…………ideal for lie-ins. We did feedback to the manager that a bowl of fresh fruit would enhance the breakfast experience. You won’t need an alarm clock however, as church bells start at 0900. This didn’t bother me, but irritated my partner. Free internet, and if you need a laptop they will lend you one for one euro an hour.
reviews.title: A little Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: On check day, there are showers and toilets in the basement, and towels to use.
reviews.title: Immaculate hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The town of Nerja is idyllic……………no high-rise blocks, lots of lovely bars, shops and restaurants, and we found the prices reasonable about 1.90 euro for a glass of wine. Beaches are easily accessible and clean. Burriana beach is the biggest and has the most facilities and is a ten minute walk.
reviews.title: Great Little Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Though close to the restaurants, shops and beaches of Nerja, this little hotel is quiet and and very pleasant. We found our rooms impeccably clean and nicely furnished. They not only included tv, a fridge, a safe, a hair dryer, soap, shampoos etc, but also offered free wifi. A rooftop terrace with a small swimming pool and a nice courtyard with bistro like tables and chairs gave the hotel an extra friendly touch. Considering that breakfast was included in the price (not luxurious but generous with a good choice of juices, bread, ham, cheese, jam, pastries, cereals and yoghurt), this hotel is excellent value for money. We cannot imagine a better place in Nerja.
reviews.title: Good location, excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Puerta del Mar for 5 nights in early October. It was excellent in every respect. The hotel has recently been beautifully refurbished. It is attractively designed throughout with a very fresh and clean appearance enhanced by stunning nature photos and some lovely indoor plants. The rooftop sun terrace with its little pool and fantastic views is perfect for spending a quiet couple of hours each day away from the busy streets below. The location must be hard to beat, within one minute of the Balcon de Europa and just 5 minutes of the pretty and not too busy Salon beach. The staff were at all times friendly and helpful, explaining where to find free car parking on arrival, and providing early breakfast when we left. The room was comfortable and would have been surprisingly quiet considering the location had we not been staying during the Feria. It meant we had to close windows at night and rely on the air con which was OK, if slightly noisy. Free wi-fi worked fine in our room and for British travellers suffering TV withdrawal symptoms, there are all the main BBC and ITV channels. Breakfasts were fine with really lovely fresh bread, although we would have welcomed a little more variety, particularly some fresh fruit. But this is a minor quibble. We recommend it highly. You could spend far more money on bigger more prestigious establishments for no greater level of comfort and certainly less charm.
reviews.title: A lovely place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: immaculate, the staff were friendly and helpful.literally on the doorstep of some lovely bars and cafes and the Balcon de Europe where you can people watch and relax over a drink and tapas minutes away as are beaches and shops, just a short stroll away. we will return next year
reviews.title: A "Must" Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed at the Puerta Del Mar Hotel 6th / 13th October.Our flight was early landing so got to hotel well before the check in time,and surprise surprise our room was ready.Fantastic room on the second floor overlooking The Plaza de Espania and mountains,good sized bedroom and bathroom with all the little extras that have been mentioned in so many other reviews.The hotel really should be more than a 2 star going by the helpfulness of all the staff and the cleanleness of the public areas as well as the bedrooms.It is in an ideal spot just off The Balcon and only acouple of minutes walk to the nearest beach.The breakfast is very much continental style but even as a vegetarian i didn,t go hungry.Would we stay at The Puerta Del Mar Hotel again?You bet we would ,cant wait.
reviews.title: We would recommend this hotel 100%

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed for 6 nights with a family of 4. (2 adults, 2 children - 13yo and 9yo). Firstly, this hotel is perfectly located in Nerja. Right beside the church in the main square of Balcon de Europa. You don't need any form of transportation but your feet to get around the town or down to the beaches. Secondly, it looks very newly renovated and is spotlessly clean everywhere. The staff are very pleasant, friendly and helpful. The hotel is small and quiet, I'd say about 24 roooms or so on 2 floors, yet you can easily mind your own business as there is very little interaction with other guests apart from in the mornings for breakfast. Breakfast was fine, standard continental, but the choice was good and fresh. (Breakfast room is a little bit small, but not too cramped) The rooms are quite spacious but aren't too elaborate with furnishings or decor, but they're perfectly clean and modern and fine for anyone who doesn't care for un-necessary fancy stuff. Air-conditioning is very good. Sound-proofing is good when balcony doors are closed to busy pedestrian street outside so your sleep won't be disrupted. (Mid-summer in Nerja has people on the streets all night long) The rooftop terrace is very spacious with plenty of sun-loungers and parasols so again, you can still mind your own business. One small criticism is that the pool is very small, but if you're lucky, like we were, there were no other children staying in the hotel at the time, so you could have it all to yourself most of the time! If you're not happy with that, you can be on the beach in less that 5 mins. The hotel offers a very useful facility for you to leave your bags, shower (towels provided) and get organised after you have checked out on the last day which we availed of. All-in-all we had a lovely stay in this hotel and would have no hesitation in staying there again.
reviews.title: Perfect location. Nice Hotel. Spotlessly Clean. Lovely Staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: Having just returned from our trip a few days ago I would glady go again to this hotel, it was quite simplistic, but very clean and tidy, with a beautiful roof terrace and friendly staff to help out with anything you needed.
reviews.title: Spot on!

reviews.text: The hotel is well situated, right in the centre of town hidden in a little side street so you never have far to walk on an evening.
reviews.title: Lived up to all expectations and more.
